meanings.definition: The act of turning inside out or outward.
meanings.sent1: The eversion of the sock made it easier to put on.
meanings.sent2: The eversions of the flower petals revealed their vibrant colors.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved a sudden eversion of the hat, surprising the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her sudden eversion of emotions left everyone bewildered.
meanings.sent5: The eversion of the umbrella in the wind was a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: The state of being turned inside out or outward.
meanings.sent1: The eversion of the pocket caused the coins to spill out.
meanings.sent2: The eversions of the fabric created a unique pattern on the dress.
meanings.sent3: The eversion of the balloon made it look like a funny animal.
meanings.sent4: The eversion of the situation turned everything upside down.
meanings.sent5: The eversion of the map revealed hidden treasures.
